name: mosapramine
content: Mosapramine (Cremin) is an atypical antipsychotic used in Japan for the treatment of schizophrenia. It is a potent dopamine antagonist with high affinity to the D2, D3, and D4 receptors, and with moderate affinity for the 5-HT2 receptors.   == See also == Carpipramine Clocapramine Fluspirilene (typical antipsychotic) Imidazopyridine   == References ==
